sub_title: PhD Fellow at United Nations University - CRIS
summary:
Nadia Tjahja is a PhD Fellow at United Nations University-CRIS and the Vrije Universiteit Brussel (VUB), working on the project “The contribution of global and regional multistakeholder mechanisms in improving global governance (GREMLIN)”, which is a collaboration between UNU-CRIS, VUB and the Centre for EU Studies at Ghent University. She is supervised by Prof. Dr. Jamal Shahin.

She was the CEO of Sunium, an organisation which facilitates multistakeholder discussions with systems thinking methodologies. Sunium also designs and organises courses in systems modelling and engages in research, where Nadia’s areas of engagement are Internet Governance; Sustainability; and Peace and Security.

Nadia has advocated over ten years for youth participation in education and politics and continues to empower and train young people to contribute to international policy-making. Nadia was the former Vice President Communications at Young European Leadership, where she was co-project leader of the Young European Council 2015, awarded with the European Charlemagne Youth Prize 2016 and Agency Coordinator of the 2016 prize-winning online international source verification and fact checking campaign Newsworthy, which engaged 25,000 young people world-wide in fact checking and source verification. She was Steering Committee Member representing WEOG for the UN Youth Coalition on Internet Governance 2017-2019 where her projects included the Working Group on Youth Participation at the IGF, YCIG-EU relations, and providing visa application support for members of the Global South to IGF events hosted in the EU.

Currently, Nadia is the Communications Chair of the Global Internet Governance Academic Network (GigaNet), her projects include facilitating the GigaNet Global Digital Compact Consultation, academia-media relations and the GigaNet Communications strategy. She is also a member of the European Dialogue on Internet Governance (EuroDIG) Secretariat as the YOUthDIG Coordinator where she organises the European youth IGF, facilitates youth activities and speaks on youth participation in Internet Governance. She sits on several boards and working groups including the IGF Youth Track, the Youth Advisory Board of EURid and as Steering Group Expert for the research on Artificial Intelligence and young people for the Council of Europe - European Commission.

She is a graduate from the College of Europe (Natolin) and Vesalius College (Brussels).

projects.title: Seminar on Youth Participation in Internet Governance
projects.description: The Council of Europe brought together 35 experts to attend the seminar  on “Youth participation in Internet Governance” which aimed to explore how participation of young people in shaping the Internet can be ensured without reproducing and creating new patterns of exclusion and will formulate recommendations for future action to be taken by the Youth Department of the Council of Europe in order to support young people and their organisations meaningful participation in Internet Governance processes.

projects.title: Young European Council 2017
projects.description:
The Young European Council (YEC) is an award-winning international conference organised by Young European Leadership (YEL), which is focused on bringing together young people who are passionate about the future of the European Union and who are determined to make their voices heard in today’s policy and decision making. 

In addition, the YEC 2017 was held under the patronage of the Estonian Presidency of the Council of the European Union. The YEC 2016 was held under the Auspices of the Slovak Presidency in the Council of the European Union and the High Patronage of the European Parliament.

contributors.headline: PhD Fellow at United Nations University - CRIS

projects.title: Young European Council 2015
projects.description:
The Young European Council (YEC) is an award-winning international conference organised by Young European Leadership (YEL), which is focused on bringing together young people who are passionate about the future of the European Union and who are determined to make their voices heard in today’s policy and decision making. 

The YEC2015 won the European Charlemagne Youth Prize 2016 as a top-three project in the European Union. The Prize is awarded to projects that “foster understanding, promote the development of a shared sense of European identity, and offer practical examples of Europeans living together as one community“. The YEC 2015 was selected as best project from the United Kingdom and competed against the representatives of all the 28 national projects, winning third place.

projects.title: #Hashtag
projects.description: #Hashtag” is a monthly TV series broadcasted live on YouTube, EU TV and on UNTV. This program takes a live discussion format and provides a secure venue for youth to speak honestly and openly about issues they face every day. The first live discussion took place in Brussels on 25 May 2015 on the topic: “Identity - Why do I or do I not feel European?”

projects.title: Young European Council 2014
projects.description: The Young European Council (YEC) 2014 gathered together in Brussels 70 students and young professionals from more than 15 countries from October 20-23 to assess together three key issues that Europe is facing: Education to Employment, Digital Revolution and Sustainable Development. They met with experts and decision makers from the European Commission, think-tanks and other institutions to exchange views and propose concrete recommendations to all European institutions about how to improve the EU guidelines to meet and exceed the Europe 2020 benchmarks. This activity is key to bring insights from the youth to the attention of our policymakers.

projects.title: 12th ASEF Journalists' Seminar
projects.description:
The Asia-Europe Foundation brought together 26 journalists and media professionals (13 from Asia and 13 from Europe) to attend a 2-day training-oriented event which aims to explore how a trust-based approach to reporting can be adopted and strengthened by media and journalists in Asia and Europe. The programme aims to address journalists' needs and challenges by providing them with the tools needed to tackle disinformation in the digital age.
#MediaTrust #Misinformation #Disinformation

projects.title: European Youth Convention
projects.description:
From 9 to 12 March 2017, 150 young leaders will gather at the European Parliament in Strasbourg. Their mission is to write a new constitution for Europe. The participants in the Convention are young people from European and local civil society. They are at the same time influencers and spokespersons of youth in their country and within their networks.

Together they will produce two texts:
√ The Strasbourg Declaration, a call to rebuild Europe.
√ A Constitution for Europe. This text has the objective to bring Europe closer to its citizens.

projects.title: P2P: Challenging Extremism
projects.description:
P2P: Challenging Extremism is an academic project sponsored by Vesalius College. Its goal is to challenge extremism by providing source verified news articles, training information on source verification and outreach programmes designed to teach source verification skills to youth. We believe that with the right tools in hand, everyone can play a role in combatting extremism.

The P2P:	Challenging Extremism competition provides an opportunity for students to create and activate their own social media campaigns to challenge violent extremist ideology, propaganda and recruitment messaging. In addition to motivating students to become involved in countering violent extremism, the Challenge also builds a community of interested and engaged young people living shared values to counter violent extremism from across the United States, Canada, the Middle East, North Africa and Europe.

projects.title: International Visitor Leadership Program
projects.description:
The International Visitor Leadership Program (IVLP) is the U.S. Department of State’s premier professional exchange program. Through short-term visits to the United States, current and emerging foreign leaders in a variety of fields experience this country firsthand and cultivate lasting relationships with their American counterparts.

The IVLP focused on countering violent extremism and conducted both professional meetings and cultural activities in Washington D.C., New York and San Francisco. It included an invitation to the White House to meet with representatives of the National Security Council to present our projects and discuss topics including challenging violent extremism in schools and online radicalisation.

profile_positions.title: Co-coordinator of the Digital Governance Cluster

profile_positions.description:
I'm working on the project “The contribution of global and regional multistakeholder mechanisms in improving global governance (GREMLIN: Global and REgional MuLtistakeholder INstitutions)” with Dr. Diana Potjomkina and supervised by  Prof. Dr. Jamal Shahin. It is a collaboration between the United Nations University Institute on Comparative Regional Integration Studies (UNU-CRIS), the Vrije Universiteit Brussel (VUB) and the Centre for EU Studies at the University of Ghent. 

My PhD research focus is on Internet Governance, multistakeholderism and systems thinking, but I also have research interests in Digital Sovereignty, EU governance, EU digital policies and media literacy.
profile_positions.title: PhD Fellow

company.name: EuroDIG - European Dialogue on Internet Governance

profile_positions.company: EuroDIG - European Dialogue on Internet Governance
profile_positions.description:
The Youth Dialogue on Internet Governance (YOUthDIG) is a yearly pre-event to the European Dialogue on Internet Governance (EuroDIG) aimed to foster active youth participation. During YOUthDIG, 30 young people from throughout Europe learn about Internet Governance, and discuss and exchange ideas with experienced internet policy practitioners. During this time they will also be developing YOUthDIG messages that are presented at EuroDIG but also the global IGF.

YOUthDIG Activities:
▪ Coordinating the YouthDIG Organising Team
▪ Facilitating the Youth Messages process
▪ Organising the logistics to hold YOUthDIG in the respective host country
▪ Organising and participating in related youth activities worldwide
▪ Advising in expert and stakeholder consultations on meaningful youth participation

EuroDIG Activites
▪ Moderating the Main Auditorium since 2020
▪ Remote moderating and technical support since 2018
▪ Managing the volunteering team
▪ Coordinating with session reporters
▪ Supporting session organisers
▪ Conducting event management training such as moderating events, moderating meetings, remote moderation, customer service, among others

Projects
▪ European Conference and Mobility Funding
▪ YOUthDIG representative to the IGF 2022 and 2023 Youth Track
profile_positions.title: YOUthDIG Coordinator

profile_positions.company: EuroDIG - European Dialogue on Internet Governance
profile_positions.title: YOUthDIG Org Team & Lead Facilitator of the Youth Messages

company.name: The Global Internet Governance Academic Network (GigaNet)

profile_positions.company: The Global Internet Governance Academic Network (GigaNet)
profile_positions.description:
The Global Internet Governance Academic Network (GigaNet) is an international association of academic researchers. The network was founded in 2006 by a group of scholars engaged in the WSIS, WGIG, and the IGF processes to support multidisciplinary scholarship on internet governance. Members include researchers from a wide range of disciplines and locations who are contributing to research, teaching, and engagement in local, regional, and international debates on internet governance.

Activities:
▪Website, listserv and social media management
▪Managing the Repository of Internet Governance Syllabi
▪Supporting membership committee
▪ Member of the GigaNet Annual Symposium Programme Committee

Projects:
▪Academic-Media relations
▪New GigaNet Symposium Repository
profile_positions.title: Communications Chair

company.name: Council of Europe and European Commission

profile_positions.company: Council of Europe and European Commission
profile_positions.description: To help the youth sector understand the role of AI in the future, the the EU-Council of Europe Youth Partnership is launching a study on AI relevance and impact on young people, involving relevant Council of Europe (CCJ) and EU (Salto) partners. This study will contribute to developing knowledge and a better understanding of the perspectives and opportunities offered by digital transitions in a broad sense, which is one of the objectives of the European Year of Youth. I've been invited to join the Steering Group to provide my expertise to assist the direction of the study.
profile_positions.title: Steering Group Expert for the research on Artificial Intelligence and young people

profile_positions.description:
EURid is the award winning registry manager of the .eu, .ею (Cyrillic script) and .ευ (Greek script) country code top-level domain names by appointment of the European Commission. Since 2005, EURid has been entrusted to provide registry services in all EU languages.

The Youth Committee is an advisory body that develops advice to inject energy, new ideas, momentum and youth's perspective to EURid's approach to Internet Governance actions that could help EURid to consider improvements in .eu policies and procedures.

Activities:
▪ Develop advice to EURid’s approach to Internet Governance actions that could help EURid to consider improvements in .eu policies and procedures
▪ Participate at relevant internet governance events
▪ Review/propose cooperation with international or regional youth organisations
▪ Engage in educational activities to raise awareness on the .eu TLD
profile_positions.title: Member of the Youth Advisory Committee

profile_positions.description:
SALTO PI has established an advisory board to co-create a coordinated approach on Digital Transformation, one of the horizontal priorities in the new generation of EU Youth Programmes: the Erasmus+ and the European Solidarity Corps (2021-2027).

The main task of the advisory board is to advise SALTO PI on development of the approach towards digital transformation in the youth field and in the EU Youth programmes, and to help to create a Digital Transformation topic for the Participation Resource Pool.
profile_positions.title: Advisor on Digital Transformation

profile_positions.description:
Sunium is a social enterprise that engages in training, research and facilitation of conflict resolution and negotiations activities through systems thinking. Our mission is to foster and safeguard the open and informed society by promoting participatory democracy through new ways of thinking and new tools for governing.

Activities
• Lead and support project developments at European and International scale that advocate for an open and informed society through systems thinking, technological developments and entrepreneurship.	
• Facilitate international negotiations and conflict resolution through the Malik Syntegration Methodology.
• Set up executive courses on communications, systems thinking, political risk and policy making.
• Research and develop new methods of conflict resolution and international negotiations
• Manage the overall operations and resources of the social enterprise.
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder & CEO

company.name: UN IGF Youth Coalition on Internet Governance

profile_positions.company: UN IGF Youth Coalition on Internet Governance
profile_positions.description:
In November 2018, I was re-elected for a second and final term as Steering Committee Member representing the Western European and Others Group of the United Nations Youth Coalition on Internet Governance.

Activities
• YOUthDIG Organising Team (November 2018 - July 2019)
• Co-Focal Point for Workshop 8 & Plenary 7 at the European Dialogue on Internet Governance on Tackling Online Harms
• YCIG liaison to the IGF Secretariat
• YCIG liaison to the Council of Europe
• YCIG liaison to the European Union
• Consult at European Parliament Youth Networking Event “Have your say in what the European Parliament should do for youth”
• Consult the incoming MAG Chair on IGF & Capacity Building for youth
• Meeting with Dutch Secretary of State Ms Mona Keijzer on Dutch Youth Participation and the YouthDIG Messages
• Teaching News Literacy and Media Literacy courses
• Outreach campaign to youth in rural areas involved with using the Internet for the Sustainable Development Goals, Internet to empower Women, and Internet to combat violent extremism narratives online to attend IGF 2019 & 2020 (August 2019 - November 2019)
• Organiser and moderator at the UN Internet Governance Forum 2019 on "Youth Participation at the IGF"
• Liaison for YCIG participation at the UN Internet Governance Forum 2019 Main Session on "DC's and SDGs"
• Launch the Youth Champions Database
profile_positions.title: Steering Committee Member (WEOG)

profile_positions.company: UN IGF Youth Coalition on Internet Governance
profile_positions.description:
The Youth Coalition on Internet Governance (YCIG) is an United Nations Internet Governance Forum Dynamic Coalition. YCIG advocates for the voice of children, young people, and young professionals in Internet governance-related fora, negotiations, and processes. It was established with the understanding that it is imperative that youth be included in such processes and its associated decision-making, share ideas and best practices from local and regional perspectives within the global Internet governance community, and enhance the implementation of relevant, agreed-upon frameworks and strategic initiatives.

I was elected to represent the Western European and Others Group following the UN Regional Groups structure, and serve as the contact point for the Eastern European Group.

Activities
• Panellist at the UN Internet Governance Forum 2017 on "Fake News and Possible Solutions to Access Information"
• Focal Point and Moderator of Plenary 2 at European Dialogue on Internet Governance (EuroDIG) 2018 on "Information Disorder: Causes, Risks and Remedies"
• Focal Point and Moderator of Flash Session "EU Digital Education Action Plan" at EuroDIG 2018
• Organiser and Speaker at the UN Internet Governance Forum 2018 on "Youth Participation at the IGF"
• Co-Organiser and Moderator at the UN Internet Governance Forum 2018 Main Session on "Development, Innovation and Economic Issues"
• YCIG liaison to the IGF Secretariat
• YCIG liaison to the Council of Europe
• YCIG liaison to the European Union
• EU Code Week Promotor 
• Meeting with the Cabinet of Commissioner Gabriel
• Council of Europe workshop on Youth Participation
• Launch the Youth Experts List and the YCIG Working Group on Youth Participation at the IGF
profile_positions.title: Steering Committee Member (WEOG & EEG)

profile_positions.description: In September 2017, I accepted the Treasury portfolio whilst retaining the Communications and Legal portfolio's. As Treasurer, I sit on the Executive Board and oversee and present YEL's budgets, accounts and financial statements to the Board and the General Assembly. I develop and enforce internal controls and financial management policies, and ensure accurate and complete financial reporting and proper maintenance of financial records and information/tax returns that meet all legal conditions.
profile_positions.title: Treasurer

profile_positions.description: After chairing the Education to Employment panel at the Young European Council 2014, I was offered to join Young European Leadership as Programming Officer in November 2014 and was offered the position of Director of Communications in June 2015. I was co-project leader and head of communications for the Young European Council 2015, which was awarded the European Charlemagne Youth Prize 2016 (3rd prize), and appointed to the executive board as Vice President Communications in January 2016 leading on legal, internal and external communications strategy, media partnerships, project and event management, public relations and the management of my departments.  In September 2017, I was offered the Treasury portfolio to add to my Communications and Legal portfolio's.
profile_positions.title: Vice President Communications

profile_positions.description: Newsworthy began through a competition to "challenge extremism" from the U.S. State Department, EdVenture and Facebook. Our team, made up of undergraduate students from Vesalius College, put together an international campaign centered around teaching media literacy through source verification and factchecking as a way to challenge violent extremism and online radicalisation. The final product included an active webpage , a Facebook page with nearly 25,000 followers and a Twitter account. Due to the success of the project, our team won second place out of more than 50 international and U.S. universities.
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder and Agency Coordinator
